Recall the ideal gas law: PV = nRT
Explanation of ideal gas law variables: P is pressure, V is volume, n is number of moles, R is gas constant, T is absolute temperature
Since the right sides of both equations are equal: p₍B₎(2V₀) = p₀V₀
Solving for p₍B₎: p₍B₎ = p₀V₀/(2V₀) = p₀/2
